title: 109_s3584
content: The Act titled "Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006" mandates training programs for supervisors. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 mandates training programs for supervisors, including interactive instructor-based training on developing goals and objectives with employees. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 requires supervisors to engage in activities such as setting performance goals, conducting appraisals, mentoring employees, managing unacceptable performance, and providing training on prohibited personnel practices. Experienced supervisors also mentor new supervisors in areas like communication, critical thinking, and teamwork. The Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 mandates supervisors to complete training programs within specific timeframes and receive credit for prior similar training. The Office of Personnel Management will establish regulations to ensure agency compliance with the Act. The amendments made by the Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006 require individuals appointed as supervisors to complete training programs within 3 years of the effective date of the Act. Individuals appointed as supervisors must complete training programs within 3 years of the effective date of the Federal Supervisor Training Act of 2006, and every 3 years thereafter in accordance with specific sections of the title. SEC. 3. MANAGEMENT COMPETENCY STANDARDS. Chapter 43 of title 5, United States Code is amended to include new management competency standards for supervisors. The Office of Personnel Management will provide guidance to agencies on these standards, and each agency must develop performance assessment standards for supervisors based on this guidance. The Office of Personnel Management will provide guidance on new management competency standards for supervisors. Agencies must assess supervisor capacity and implement training programs to address identified issues. Agencies are required to submit progress reports annually to the Office of Personnel Management. Technical amendments are made to the table of sections in Chapter 43 of title 5, United States Code. Management competency standards are being updated, with regulations being amended to reflect the changes. The reference in the code is also being updated accordingly.
